title: National Heritage Conservation Commission (Ngonye Falls) (National Monument) (Declaration) Order, 2023
content:
17th August, 2023 Statutory Instruments 205
GOVERNMENT OF ZAMBIA
STATUTORY INSTRUMENT NO. 33 OF 2023
The National Heritage Conservation Commission Act
(Laws, Volume 12, Cap 173)
The National Heritage Conservation Commission
(Ngonye Falls) (National Monument) (Declaration) Order,
2023
IN EXERCISE of the powers contained in section 27 of the National
Heritage Conservation Commission Act, the following Order is
made:
1. This Order may be cited as the National Heritage Title
Conservation Commission (Ngonye Falls) (National Monument)
(Declaration) Order, 2023.
2. The heritage described in the Schedule is declared a national Declaration
monument.SCHEDULE of national
monument
Copies of this Statutory Instrument can be obtained from the Government Printer,
P.O. Box 30136, 10101 Lusaka. Price K 4.00 each.
206 Statutory Instruments 17th August, 2023
SCHEDULE
(Paragraph 2)
NGONYE FALLS
LOCATION
The site is located in Western Province, Sioma District at latitude 16°39’15’’S and longitude
23°34’2’’E.
STATEMENT OF SIGNIFICANCE
The site presents a unique formation similar to that of the Victoria Falls. The site was formed
as a result of volcanic eruptions in Botswana that created the basaltic rocks which are now eroded
by the power of water creating the drop for the waterfall. The site is spectacular and has great
potential for tourism development as it is on the way to Sioma Gwezi National Park.
BOUNDARY DESCRIPTION
The described area measures approximately 10,877 hectares.
The described area is shown on a plan marked red, signed by the Surveyor-General and
deposited in the office of the Surveyor-General and the National Heritage Conservation
Commission, Lusaka.
R. SIKUMBA,
LUSAKA Minister of Tourism
11th August, 2023
(MOT.13/7/1)
